triples.evidence: It is highly appealing to integrate the two promising technologies together to build an efficient Arm-based storage server with NVMeoF.
With appropriate NIC optimizations, we have observed a throughput increase by up to 42.5% and a decrease of the 95th percentile tail latency by up to 14.6%.
With appropriate NIC optimizations, we have observed a throughput increase by up to 42.5% and a decrease of the 95th percentile tail latency by up to 14.6%.

In contrast to the common expectation, the NIC optimization, such as interrupt moderation, can substantially reduce the 95th percentile tail latency by up to 14.6% while improving the throughput by up to 42.5%.

In contrast to the common expectation, the NIC optimization, such as interrupt moderation, can substantially reduce the 95th percentile tail latency by up to 14.6% while improving the throughput by up to 42.5%.

axioms: improves rdfs:domain SSD/EcosystemAndIntegrationContext/Interconnects/NVMe-oF (RoCE, TCP, FC); rdfs:range SSD/MetricsHealthAndState/Performance/99th Percentile Latency.

mappings.label: NVMe
mappings.notes: NVMe is a standard interface type for SSDs.

mappings.label: NVMeoF
mappings.notes: NVMeoF is a specific interconnect technology for SSDs.

mappings.notes: Mapped to the closest available performance metric.
